description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the secure boot security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-38065), the following updates must be applied:

1. Identify the version of Windows in use to determine the appropriate patch:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): KB5040442
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2 (x64): KB5040442
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2 (x64): KB5040431
   - Windows 10 (x64 and 32-bit): KB5040448
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64 and 32-bit): KB5040427

2. Download the relevant update package using the following links:
   - [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
   - [KB5040448](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040448)
   - [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)

3. Install the updates following standard procedures (using Windows Update or manual installation).

4. Restart the system to apply changes.

**Details**:
This set of updates addresses a critical security feature bypass vulnerability associated with secure boot settings. Applying these updates enhances the firmware security and mitigates the risk of exploitation related to heap-based buffer overflow issues (CWE-122). Ensure the system is fully backed up before proceeding with the installation of these updates.
